title: Senior Analytics Engineer (EU Timezones Only)
description:
The Data Team

You will be part of the data team. We work cross-functionally with other teams to bring data-driven impact to Fabulous and its business units like Product Growth, User Acquisition and Finance.

Practically the team handles 3 data areas:
‚Ä¢ Data Project Management: Based on business needs, we sort requests, refine requirements and ACs with business and/or data stakeholders, prioritise, plan and executive while communicating proactive and frequently to ensure visibility and a well connected feedback loop with involved parties (reviewer, data stakeholder, business stakeholder)
‚Ä¢ Applied Analytics & Data Science: Data Exploration, Defining appropriate and agile analytics approach. We aim for simplicity and interpretability but don't shy away from complexity when faced with it. All new projects have a strong Data Science component during the first MVP iteration
‚Ä¢ Analytics Engineering: Data Modelling and Transformations to serve build, maintain and scale our Analytics Pipelines. Practically, as soon as an MVP gets validated by different stakeholders, we start implementing it and improving it iteratively in our dbt project. Testing and data observability is a highly important component. Proper architecture that helps manage TechDebt is another key element here as well.

All members of the team are expected to excel in at least 2 of the above mentioned areas to be autonomously impactful.

We work in an agile manner by splitting bigger projects into iterations that rarely expand beyond 3 weeks to ensure impact.

We have a modern cloud-based Data-Stack (Fivetran - Big Query - dbt - Amplitude - Metabase - Looker Studio) and want to consolidate our ranks with a capable well-rounded Senior Analytics Engineer who can integrate our agile context smoothly and bring value quickly.
Expectations | Duties

This role is highly critical to the continuous success of the data science team:
‚Ä¢ You will work on Data Modelling and Analytics Engineering project to improve, enrich and maintain our data models and Analytics pipelines. Those projects will be in close collaboration with the head of Data & Analytics as the main stakeholder. The objective of those project is to further enable data analytics and scientist from the team to bring more impact to the business use cases they are working on in collaboration with business teams.
‚Ä¢ You will be responsible for contributing effectively to our code base: building, testing, reviewing and maintaining solid analytics pipelines using SQL and dbt. Help managing TechDebt and improving engineering practices and the project's architecture are also important responsibilities for this role. Solid methodical testing is key here to strengthen Data Observability.
‚Ä¢ You are expected to gradually own some aspects of the team's responsibilities (some parts of the code base, , have a strong saying in how the analytics project's architecture should evolve, contribute to team's evolution and continuous growth, help data analysts and scientist improve and strengthen their engineering skills ...)
‚Ä¢ You will be expected to speak up your mind and contribute proactively and effectively to improving the team's practices, cohesion, impact and mission
‚Ä¢ You are expected to be highly autonomous and show a sense of ownership and ability to effectively manage your own projects and stakeholders. This should be fulfilled with minimum guidance from the Head of Data & Analytics
‚Ä¢ You will help mentoring more junior members and sharing knowledge and practices within the team to level up everyone's skills
‚Ä¢ You are expected to contribute effectively to our functional documentation in a way that is clear, concise and useful for future collaborators and readers

Requirements
‚Ä¢ University Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or Applied Mathematics
‚Ä¢ A minimum of 4 years of experience in Data or Analytics Engineering
‚Ä¢ Excellent hands on skills in Data Modelling
‚Ä¢ Excellent SQL skills (even better if this is coupled with dbt experience or a similar sql based data modelling tool)
‚Ä¢ Excellent Engineering skills (testing, clean coding, peer-reviewing, CD/CI, git workflows, agile workflows, etc‚Ä¶)
‚Ä¢ Previous experience working with modern data stack tools and cloud based data warehouse (BQ, Snowflake, Redshift,..)
‚Ä¢ Sound business acumen to mange your own projects and your business stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Self-Starter with the ability to work autonomously and own ones projects fully
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)
‚Ä¢ Comfortable in a remote work environment (we are a remote-first organisation)

Good to Have:
‚Ä¢ Prior experience with some of the tools we use in our Data-Stack (Amplitude, dbt, BigQuery, Metabase)
‚Ä¢ Good analytical and statistical intuition
‚Ä¢ Hands-on Data Analysis skills
‚Ä¢ Prior experience managing modern dbt data pipelines
‚Ä¢ Prior experience in an agile start-up environment

Benefits

About Us

An award-winning health, wellness, & coaching company that creates apps which fall the top ten internationally. Our science-based approach sits squarely in the tech-for-good lane, helping people live their best lives. Everyone who has joined this company is committed to using evidence-based research to find the absolute best ways to change lives for the better.

Our History

Three co-founders created the Fabulous app: Sami, Amine, and Taylor. Growing up in Tunisia, Sami and Amine were only 16 when they met. With their early iteration, they reached out to Taylor, an award-winning designer in Malaysia. Their vision was welcomed into an incubation lab for startups at Duke University led by world-renowned Behavioral Economics Professor Dan Ariely. Our Chief Storyteller Jaz co-founded the Introductory Psychology program at Stanford University.

Our Approach

We use a behavioral economics lens to help individuals find that 'on switch' inside them to achieve their fullest potential. What has emerged is a system that transforms tiny habits into profound long-term changes. A world in which people with ADHD thrive. A method for gratitude to reach through difficulty. A sanctuary to seek out your true purpose. A fountain of knowledge. A space for rest and self compassion.

Our Mission

Help every individual discover the wonderful person inside themselves by creating: beautiful, evidence-based, life-changing products.

Our Environment

The first thing that sets us apart is that we‚Äôre not a place at all. While we‚Äôre a remote company, it‚Äôs not unusual to feel you know your teammates better than those you‚Äôve shared an office with in the past. Ours is a professionally nourishing environment that is flexible and fully remote. Team members enjoy in house challenges and Slack event and work across a variety of tools. Meetings are kept to a minimum and deep work is encouraged.

Our Awards
‚Ä¢ Apple Best Apps of 2018
‚Ä¢ Editor‚Äôs app choice in more than 30 countries
‚Ä¢ Winner of Google‚Äôs Material Design Award
‚Ä¢ Best App Finalist in Google Play Awards
‚Ä¢ Consistently ranking in the top ten Health & Fitness apps
‚Ä¢ Backed by Facebook Startup Lab and Microsoft Venture

Our Norms

Ownership : Be the CEO of your tasks. No one is watching over your shoulder. Be the proof.

Open Communication: Constructive ideas are always flying across time zones.

Deep Work: Disconnect. Find your flow. Become industrious. It‚Äôs about the work here.

Always Offer Context: Sharing rationale works wonders in asynchronous conversations.

Impeccable Agreement: Promise, then follow through. Everyone relies on everyone.

Egos are checked at the door. Those who join our workforce place themselves in service of our members.

Our Values

#collaboration #craftsmanship #feedback #respect #responsibility #simplicity #speed

Our Future

To this day, over 30 million people have started their journey to better themselves with our apps. We are creating a generation of change-makers, with the same drive to help others, each in their own way.

Our Invitation

At Fabulous, every team member is a sculptor in their own right. Together, we help millions of users step out of their block of stone and step into the fullest version of their life through behavioral science. Tell us what drives you; if you were to pick up your tools, what would you contribution look like?

Help every individual discover the wonderful person inside themselves by creating: beautiful, evidence-based, life-changing products.

Our Environment

The first thing that sets us apart is that we‚Äôre not a place at all. While we‚Äôre a remote company, it‚Äôs not unusual to feel you know your teammates better than those you‚Äôve shared an office with in the past. Ours is a professionally nourishing environment that is flexible and fully remote. Team members enjoy in house challenges and Slack event and work across a variety of tools. Meetings are kept to a minimum and deep work is encouraged.

Our Awards
‚Ä¢ Apple Best Apps of 2018
‚Ä¢ Editor‚Äôs app choice in more than 30 countries
‚Ä¢ Winner of Google‚Äôs Material Design Award
‚Ä¢ Best App Finalist in Google Play Awards
‚Ä¢ Consistently ranking in the top ten Health & Fitness apps
‚Ä¢ Backed by Facebook Startup Lab and Microsoft Venture

Our Norms

Ownership : Be the CEO of your tasks. No one is watching over your shoulder. Be the proof.

Open Communication: Constructive ideas are always flying across time zones.

Deep Work: Disconnect. Find your flow. Become industrious. It‚Äôs about the work here.

Always Offer Context: Sharing rationale works wonders in asynchronous conversations.

Impeccable Agreement: Promise, then follow through. Everyone relies on everyone.

Egos are checked at the door. Those who join our workforce place themselves in service of our members.

Our Values

#collaboration #craftsmanship #feedback #respect #responsibility #simplicity #speed

Our Future

To this day, over 30 million people have started their journey to better themselves with our apps. We are creating a generation of change-makers, with the same drive to help others, each in their own way.

Our Invitation

At Fabulous, every team member is a sculptor in their own right. Together, we help millions of users step out of their block of stone and step into the fullest version of their life through behavioral science. Tell us what drives you; if you were to pick up your tools, what would you contribution look like?

title: Principal Data Engineer
description:
full-time

remote from anywhere in the EU

Description

The Principal will be responsible for supporting complex or leading singular projects related to data engineering requirements and initiatives across Research and Development. The Principal will support data projects from across the business including Clinical, Pre-Clinical, Non-Clinical, Chemistry, RWD and Omics.

Essential Functions
‚Ä¢ Support the design, development and maintenance of data pipelines for processing Research and Development data from diverse sources (Clinical Trials, Medical Devices, Pre-Clinical, Omics, Real World Data) utilizing the AWS technology platform.
‚Ä¢ Create and optimize ETL/ELT processes for structured and unstructured data using Python, R, SQL, AWS services and other tools.
‚Ä¢ Build and maintain data repositories using AWS S3 and FSx technologies. Establish data warehousing solutions using Amazon Redshift.
‚Ä¢ Build and maintain standard data models.
‚Ä¢ Develop data quality frameworks, validation processes and KPIs to ensure accuracy and consistency of data pipelines.
‚Ä¢ Implement data versioning and lineage tracking to support data traceability, regulatory compliance and audit requirements.
‚Ä¢ Create and maintain documentation for data processes, architectures, and workflows.
‚Ä¢ Implement modern software development best practices (e.g. Code Versioning, DevOps, CD/CI).
‚Ä¢ Maintain compliance with data privacy regulations such as HIPAA, GDP
‚Ä¢ May be required to develop, deliver or support data literacy training across R&D.

Required Knowledge, Skills And Abilities
‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of data engineering tools such as Python, R and SQL for data processing.
‚Ä¢ Strong proficiency with AWS services particularly S3, Redshift, FSx, Glue, Lambda.
‚Ä¢ Strong proficiency with relational databases.
‚Ä¢ Strong background in data modeling and database design.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with unstructured database technologies (e.g. NoSQL) and other database types (e.g. Graph).
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with Containerization such as Docker and EKS/Kubernetes.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with one or more RnD research process and associated regulatory requirements.
‚Ä¢ Exposure to healthcare data standards (CDISC, HL7, FHIR, SNOMED CT, OMOP, DICOM).
‚Ä¢ Exposure to big data technologies and handling.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of machine learning operations (MLOps) and model deployment.
‚Ä¢ Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities.
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
‚Ä¢ Experience working in an Agile development environment.

Minimum Requirements
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Life Sciences, or other relevant scientific fields; Master‚Äôs Degree preferred
‚Ä¢ 3-5 years of experience in data engineering, with at least 1.5 years focusing on healthcare, research or clinical related data

title: Digital Data Engineer (w/m)
description:
We combine breakthrough science and advanced technology to develop life-changing medicines and vaccines.
Digital & Data is at the heart of Sanofi: our ambition is to be the leading digital healthcare platform to develop & deliver medicine faster, enable healthcare professionals to improve treatments and help patients improve their health. Our scale, strong connections within health ecosystems across leveraging the world, and ability to leverage Sanofi's capabilities make us the best place to push the boundaries of medicine through technology.
Join us on our journey in enabling Sanofi's Digital Transformation through becoming an AI first organization. An extensive portfolio of AI products driving every stage of the company's value chain, from R&D and trials to manufacturing, supply chain, and commercial operations.
‚Ä¢ A technological foundation enabling the reliable, consistent, efficient, secure, scalable, and responsible development of Generative AI (Gen AI) products by optimizing system architecture, processes, and services.
‚Ä¢ State-of-the-art Tech Stack: Globally deployed products using a state-of-the-art technology stack.

Gather/organize large & complex data assets, and perform relevant analysis
‚Ä¢ Ensure the quality of the data in coordination with Data Analysts and Data Scientists (peer validation)
‚Ä¢ Propose and implement relevant data models for each business case
‚Ä¢ Create data models and optimize queries performance
‚Ä¢ Partner with Product Owner and Data Analysts to prioritize the pipeline implementation plan
‚Ä¢ Partner with Software Engineers and Data scientists to design pipelines relevant for business requirements
‚Ä¢ Leverage existing or create new "standard data pipelines" within Sanofi to bring value through business use cases
‚Ä¢ Ensure best practices in data manipulation are enforced end-to-end
‚Ä¢ Actively contribute to Data governance community
‚Ä¢ You are a dynamic Data Engineer interested in challenging the status quo to ensure the seamless creation and operation of the data pipelines that are needed for the enterprise data and analytics initiatives following industry standard practices and tools for the betterment of our global patients and customers.

You are a valued influencer and leader who has contributed to making key datasets available to data scientists, analysts, and consumers throughout the enterprise to meet vital business use needs. You have a keen eye for improvement opportunities while continuing to fully comply with all data quality, security, and governance standards.
Experience working with data models and query tuning
‚Ä¢ Experience on working within compliance (e.g.: quality, regulatory - data privacy, GxP, SOX) and cybersecurity requirements is a plus
‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of SQL, relational databases and vector databases (e.g., Experience in Data warehousing solutions (Snowflake a plus)
‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of scripting languages (Python, R a plus)
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with Project Management Tools (JIRA, Confluence a plus)
‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of ServiceNow and monitoring tool such as Datadog, Splunk, BPPM
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, or relevant field

English, French
Contribute to a company that is not only a leader in healthcare but also a pioneer in digital transformation, shaping the future of global health.
‚Ä¢ Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it's through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally.
‚Ä¢ Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and wellbeing benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and at least 14 weeks' gender-neutral parental leave.
‚Ä¢ Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.

A la crois√©e des sujets data engineering, data science, IA et d√©veloppement, la Practice Data Technologies est √† l‚Äôinitiative de la construction et l‚Äô√©volution des offres Data et Technologiques au sein de Converteo. La Practice couvre un champ d‚Äôexpertises tr√®s large et intervient notamment sur :
‚Ä¢ les strat√©gies move to cloud (cadrage et impl√©mentation) avec GCP, SF, AWS, Azure ;
‚Ä¢ la conception de produits data : plateformes d'activation et de reporting in-house (Advanced Analytics / BI / Insights Sharing / Forecast / Activation Locale / CDP) ;
‚Ä¢ la mise en place de squads data chez nos clients ;
‚Ä¢ le cadrage et d√©ploiement de strat√©gies de gouvernance de la donn√©e ;
‚Ä¢ le d√©ploiement de strat√©gies IA chez nos clients ;
‚Ä¢ l‚Äôimpl√©mentation d'outils partenaires sur nos sujets strat√©giques (CDP SaaS, PriceFX)

Nos consultants savent √† la fois d√©velopper, conseiller leurs clients sur la marche √† suivre et g√©rer leur activit√© en autonomie (force de proposition, initiative). Ils sont √† m√™me de g√©rer un projet ou un produit, du cadrage jusqu'√† l'impl√©mentation et l'optimisation.

Nous recrutons un(e) Consultant Senior Data Engineer :

Apr√®s formation interne √† notre m√©thodologie et notre offre client, vous assurez, en autonomie, les missions suivantes en interne ou aupr√®s de grands comptes :
‚Ä¢ Collecte du besoin, cadrage des attentes et des t√¢ches, capacit√© √† traduire un besoin fonctionnel en action technique et chiffrer les impl√©mentations ;
‚Ä¢ Cartographie des donn√©es et des flux de donn√©es ;
‚Ä¢ Collecter, consolider et mod√©liser de gros volumes de donn√©es (Big Data, Data Warehouses, Data Lakes) sur diff√©rentes architectures (Medallion...) et mod√®les (Data Vault, OBT...) ;

- D√©velopper et automatiser (orchestration, infrastructure -IaC- et FinOps) les flux de donn√©es de bout en bout suivant divers paradigmes (ELT, ETL, streaming...) ;
‚Ä¢ S'assurer de la scalabilit√©, l'observabilit√©, la s√©curit√©, la stabilit√© et la disponibilit√© des donn√©es de la plateforme ;
‚Ä¢ Mettre en place l'orchestration et la supervision des flux pr√©cit√©es en g√©rant les cas limites.

Profil recherch√©

De formation sup√©rieure en √©cole d‚Äôing√©nieur/universit√© (niveau Bac+5 ou plus), vous justifiez d'au moins 3 ans d'exp√©rience professionnelle en tant que Data Engineer, id√©alement dans un programme data en lien avec les m√©tiers marketing.

Notre stack :
‚Ä¢ GCP / AWS / Azure
‚Ä¢ Big Query, Snowflake, RedShift, Athena, MongoDB
‚Ä¢ Python, SQL, NoSQL, Spark
‚Ä¢ Terraform, CloudFormation
‚Ä¢ dbt
‚Ä¢ CI/CD, Docker, GIT (GitHub, GitLab)
‚Ä¢ Tout type de certification est appr√©ci√©e, notamment SnowPro Core ou SnowPro Advanced.

Vous disposez des qualit√©s suivantes :
‚Ä¢ Excellente qualit√© relationnelle et r√©dactionnelle
‚Ä¢ Autonomie / Sens de l‚Äôinitiative
‚Ä¢ Ethique et rigueur
‚Ä¢ Vous avez l‚Äôesprit d‚Äô√©quipe et √™tes impliqu√©(e) dans votre travail au quotidien
‚Ä¢ Vous avez h√¢te de proposer des am√©liorations, les partager et les prioriser avec vos coll√®gues
‚Ä¢ Vous avez un niveau courant en Anglais

Notre process de recrutement
‚Ä¢ Un entretien avec notre recruteur et un Senior Manager (45min)
‚Ä¢ Un entretien technique avec deux Manager Data Engineering (1h)
‚Ä¢ Un entretien Final avec nos deux Practice Leaders (30min)

Bienvenue chez nous

Conditions du poste
‚Ä¢ Locaux situ√©s √† Paris intramuros : 40 Avenue des Terroirs de France - 75012 Paris
‚Ä¢ Contrat en CDI, statut Cadre
‚Ä¢ Poste √† pourvoir d√®s que possible

Notre petit + ?

Et parce que le bien-√™tre de l‚Äô√©quipe est au c≈ìur de notre mod√®le, quelques infos sur le cadre de travail :
‚Ä¢ 4,66 / 5 √† l‚Äôenqu√™te Happy at Work - 96% de taux de recommandation √† des proches
‚Ä¢ N¬∞1 au classement HappyIndexAtWork 2021, 2022 & 2023 des entreprises du secteur Conseil
‚Ä¢ Equilibre vie pro / vie perso (temps de travail ma√Ætris√©, mesures pour accompagner la parentalit√©)
‚Ä¢ Une politique de t√©l√©travail flexible, sans limitation de jours
‚Ä¢ √âquipement pour travailler en remote + participation aux frais du t√©l√©travail (allocation mensuelle)
‚Ä¢ Des s√©minaires d‚Äô√©quipe et des teambuilding pour se retrouver
‚Ä¢ Une multitude d‚Äôactivit√©s sportives : via GymLib ou en rejoignant les √©quipes sportives du cabinet (running, yoga, foot, basket, cross training, etc)
‚Ä¢ Valorisation des mobilit√©s douces (forfait mobilit√© durable pour les adeptes du v√©lo ou de la trottinette)
‚Ä¢ Une School interne pour se former et se certifier sur des outils continuellement
‚Ä¢ Nos collaborateurs t√©moignent sur Glassdoor

En 2021, 2022 et en 2023, Converteo occupe la 1√®re place du classement HappyIndexAtWork des entreprises du secteur Conseil, rejoignez-nous !
En 2023, Converteo occupe la 1√®re place du classement HappyWomenAtWork, classement des entreprises dans lesquelles les femmes sont les plus engag√©es et motiv√©es

title: Lead Data Engineer
description:
OPPORTUNITE :

Nous cherchons un.e Data Engineer pour nous aider √† tirer toute la valeur des donn√©es de mobilit√© de nos clients. Il s‚Äôagit d‚Äôune occasion unique de faire partie des premiers employ√©s d‚Äôune entreprise innovante qui d√©veloppe un outil puissant dans un secteur appel√© √† conna√Ætre une croissance exponentielle : la mobilit√© √©lectrique.

La transition vers l‚Äô√©lectrique est en marche mais sa r√©ussite n√©cessite de prendre en compte de nombreux facteurs li√©s √† l‚Äô√©cosyst√®me de l‚Äô√©lectrique : donn√©es des v√©hicules, des gestionnaires de flotte, des op√©rateurs de recharge, des fournisseurs d‚Äô√©nergie sont en perp√©tuel changement. En parall√®le, les entreprises n‚Äôont que peu d‚Äôinformations sur le comportement r√©el de leur flotte et la fa√ßon dont leurs sp√©cificit√©s sont compatibles avec ce nouvel √©cosyst√®me.

Exploiter efficacement ces donn√©es est donc un d√©fi majeur de cette transition que les √©quipes tech de Nelson rel√®vent, et notre v√©ritable axe de diff√©renciation face √† la concurrence

La perspective de ce poste : VP Data, Senior Data Scientist

TA MISSION :

Pour nos clients, une forte partie de notre valeur ajout√©e r√©side dans notre capacit√© √† traiter, valoriser, enrichir leurs donn√©es, en bref : les faire passer de fichiers bruts inexploit√©s √† une mine d‚Äôor informationnelle. Ton objectif sera de maintenir et renforcer cet avantage comp√©titif, dans le cadre de notre croissance rapide et des multiples nouveaux d√©fis qui se pr√©sentent
‚öôÔ∏è Industrialiser nos pipelines de traitement de donn√©es, orient√©es produit

Tu travailleras sur notre c≈ìur tech : des pipelines de pr√©traitement orchestr√©s avec Airflow, construits pour agr√©ger et transformer des donn√©es venant de nombreuses sources (constructeurs, t√©l√©matique, loueurs, op√©rateurs de recharge, fichiers RH, etc.). Chez Nelson, notre secret sauce consiste en notre capacit√© √† agr√©ger et valoriser des donn√©es vari√©es et complexes, sans erreur et en un temps record. Pour cela, nous concentrons nos efforts sur notre pipeline de preprocess. Tu travailleras donc sur ces pipelines de traitement des donn√©es, pour les aider √† r√©pondre aux enjeux suivants : flexibilit√© (prise en compte de nouveaux cas d‚Äôusage, nouvelles typologies de donn√©es, nouvelles features), robustesse, scalabilit√©.

Cela inclut d‚Äôemmener de nouvelles fonctionnalit√©s depuis l‚Äôexpression du besoin jusqu‚Äô√† la mise en production (ou du moins, la partie de ces fonctionnalit√©s relative au preprocess, main dans la main avec le back !)

En outre, nous construisons peu √† peu des connecteurs robustes (API, fichiers, SFTP) pour constructeurs, t√©l√©matique, catalogues de v√©hicules‚Ä¶ L‚Äôid√©e est d‚Äôautomatiser toutes les √©tapes du cycle de vie de la donn√©e, pour que le traitement r√©current soit fluide et fiable.
üíª Compl√©ter le pan data de la suite Nelson

Contexte. Notre produit historique, Nelson Electrify, est mature : nous avons des clients en production et des flux stables. Nous l‚Äô√©tendons d√©sormais avec deux produits compl√©mentaires, pens√©s pour le post-transition :
‚Ä¢ Nelson Charge (comprendre et optimiser la recharge)
‚Ä¢ Nelson Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) (projections de co√ªts r√©els et car policies)
‚Ä¢ Ce produit vise √† permettre aux entreprises de projeter pr√©cis√©ment les co√ªts r√©els de chaque mod√®le de v√©hicule, sur plusieurs ann√©es, en int√©grant les dimensions fiscales, sociales, √©nerg√©tiques et op√©rationnelles. Il aidera aussi √† construire des car policies optimis√©es, en tenant compte des contraintes internes et des r√©alit√©s du march√©.

Cela cr√©e un double d√©fi rare : b√¢tir des briques neuves ‚Äúfrom scratch‚Äù pour Charge et TCO, tout en faisant passer √† l‚Äô√©chelle un produit d√©j√† solide (Electrify).

Ton r√¥le. Mettre en place le socle data commun qui alimente ces trois produits : ingestion fiable, mod√®le de donn√©es clair, r√®gles de qualit√©, calculs et exposition propre vers le backend et le frontend :
‚Ä¢ R√©fl√©chir au mod√®le de donn√©es commun (canonique). Que mettre en commun ? Qu‚Äôisoler ? D√©finir clairement ce qu‚Äôest un v√©hicule, une session de charge, un site, un contrat, une facture‚Ä¶ pour tous les produits et toutes les sources.
‚Ä¢ Pipelines de preprocess : de la m√™me mani√®re que ce qui est √©voqu√© plus haut, l‚Äôenjeu est de mettre en place des pipelines de preprocess permettant d‚Äôaboutir √† des donn√©es utilisables imm√©diatement par les applications et les APIs. Il s‚Äôagit donc de construire progressivement un processing industrialis√©, comme nous l‚Äôavons fait via Airflow pour Electrify.
‚Ä¢ Briques r√©utilisables. Tu transformeras les besoins r√©currents en biblioth√®ques internes afin d‚Äôacc√©l√©rer les nouveaux cas d‚Äôusage et d‚Äô√©viter de recoder des fonctions utilis√©es dans les autres produits.

Stack & latitude technique. Tu t‚Äôappuieras sur notre stack actuelle (Airflow, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, Cloud Run). Tu pourras aussi la challenger et la compl√©ter en fonction des besoins et goulots d‚Äô√©tranglement r√©els (orchestration, transformation, stockage, monitoring, co√ªts). L‚Äôobjectif n‚Äôest pas d‚Äôempiler des outils mais de choisir les bons pour livrer plus vite et plus s√ªr.
‚õèÔ∏è D√©velopper un ou plusieurs agents IA

Nous challengeons et questionnons en permanence nos algorithmes et r√©fl√©chissons √† de nouvelles approches pour √™tre toujours plus proches de la r√©alit√© et de l‚Äôoptimalit√© dans nos recommandations. Des chantiers optimisation / machine learning se pr√©sentent donc r√©guli√®rement.

Ton objectif sera donc de mener √† bien quelques-uns de ces chantiers, et d‚Äôen tirer les conclusions n√©cessaires aux prochaines √©tapes.

Nous avons en outre identifi√© des cas d‚Äôusage pour lesquels nous aimerions mettre en place nos premiers agents IA. Si le sujet t‚Äôint√©resse, tu pourras mettre en place ces agents en bin√¥me avec In√®s.

title: Data Engineers, Paris
company_name: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development
description:
Company Description

The OECD is a global economic forum working with 36 member countries and more than 100 emerging and developing economies to make better policies for better lives. Our mission is to promote policies that will improve the economic and social well-being of people around the world. The Organisation provides a unique forum in which governments work together to share experiences on what drives economic, social and environmental change, seeking solutions to common problems.

The International Energy Agency (IEA) is an intergovernmental organisation committed to advancing security of energy supply, economic growth and environmental sustainability through energy policy co-operation. The IEA operates as an autonomous body within the framework of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development. Both the OECD and the IEA seek opportunities to work with an increasing number of non-members of growing importance to the world economy.

IEA‚Äôs Information Systems Unit (ISU) provides the IT infrastructure, systems, and applications that support the IEA‚Äôs core substantive work, including the management of energy statistics databases and related applications. The IEA is seeking to crate a talent pool for Data Engineer positions potentially upcoming in the next 12 months. Data Engineers will work on the ongoing modernization of the IEA‚Äôs data architecture. This role will allow for candidates to work on a high-performance, scalable, and cost-effective centralized data platform‚Äîgrounded in data warehouse principles and modern engineering practices‚Äîto deliver reliable, high-quality data to energy analysts and economists for in-depth market research and analysis.

Successful candidates will be given and opportunity to be considered for potential upcoming positions which may start as early as January 2026. Data Engineers will work under the supervision of the Lead Data Solution Architect and the Head of the Information Systems Unit.
Job Description

Main Responsibilities
Work with ISU and other teams to analyse, develop, test and deploy optimised, data and business intelligence solutions to help manage our growing data infrastructure.Collaborate with engineers and data analysts to build and maintain Python-based backend services that support data processing and AI applications.Contribute to the development of internal tools such as chatbots, semantic search engines, or dataset assistants using modern AI frameworks.Assist in the implementation and improvement of data pipelines, APIs, and vector search systems under senior guidance.Participate in projects that integrate language models (LLMs) like GPT or LLaMA into secure applications that respect confidentiality and data sovereignty.Help containerize applications using Docker and support deployment in our hybrid (cloud + on-prem) environment.Support testing, code reviews, and documentation of key software components.Learn about our data warehouse ecosystem and contribute to projects that improve data access, validation, or reporting.Work with senior engineers to identify innovative uses of AI and build small prototypes that can evolve into production tools..

Example Projects You‚Äôll Contribute To
Secure AI Assistant for Reports: Help build tools that allow IEA staff to ask questions and retrieve insights from internal reports, using retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) and LLMs. Data Validation Pipelines: Support the creation of automated checks that align datasets with the narratives of official publications. Open-Source LLM Experiments: Assist in experimenting with self-hosted models like Mistral or LLaMA and deploy them on-prem using tools like vLLM and LangChain. Internal Python Libraries: Contribute to shared Python codebases that make our data processing more consistent and reusable. Maintaining the IEA Data Warehouse: Participate in the upkeep and improvement of our SQL Server‚Äìbased data warehouse, helping to ensure data integrity, optimize queries, and support analytics and reporting pipelines used across the agency.

In addition to leading key projects, you‚Äôll have space to innovate‚Äîpartnering with analysts and engineers to frame and deliver AI-driven solutions with real impact.
Qualifications

Ideal Candidate Profile

Academic Background
Undergraduate degree or higher in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Management Information Systems, Data Management, or a related field.

Professional Background
3+ years of experience in data engineering, infrastructure, or software development.Very good programming skills in Python, with a good grasp of software engineering principles.Skilled in agile delivery, version control, testing, and CI/CD.Interest in learning how to work with tools like Docker, Git, Milvus, Azure, or Hugging Face Transformers.Experience building data-driven applications or APIs, with awareness of usability and long-term maintainability.Familiarity with developing user-facing tools in Dash.Strong grasp of ETL design, data pipelines (e.g., Dagster), and SQL-based data warehousing.Experience with Linux systems, virtualization (e.g., Hyper-V, VMware), and general server management.Strong knowledge of SQL and data modeling is a plus.Strong desire to work in a mission-driven environment and grow your technical skills with real mentorship.Demonstrated self-motivation and ability to work independently as well as to work collaboratively and effectively in small technical/engineering teams

Core Competencies

OECD staff are expected to demonstrate behaviours aligned to six core competencies which will be assessed as part of this hiring processes: Vision and Strategy (Level 1); Enable People (Level 1); Ethics and Integrity (Level 2); Collaboration and Horizontality (Level 2); Achieve Results (Level 2); Innovate and Embrace Change (Level 2).

There are three possible levels for each competency. The level for each competency is determined according to the specific needs of each job role and its associated grade.

To learn more about the definitions for each competency for levels 1-3, please refer to OECD Core Competencies

Languages
Excellent knowledge of written and spoken English; working knowledge of French would be an advantage. Additional Information

Closing Date
This vacancy should be filled by the beginning of 2026, and applications should reach us no later than midnight August 17, 2025 (Paris time).

Contract Duration
This is a generic recruitment to identify a talent pool for potential future upcoming positions.IEA offers a fixed-term contracts initially for 24 months, with the possibility of renewal.

What the OECD offers
Depending on level of experience, monthly salary starts at 5,185.99 EUR, plus allowances based on eligibility, exempt of French income tax.Click here to consult the Staff Regulations applicable to officials of the OECD. Please note that from 1 July 2025, all Official appointments will be made under the OECD‚Äôs new contractual modalities.Click here to learn more about what we offer and why the OECD is a great place to work. Click here to browse our People Management Guidebook and learn more about all aspects relating to people at the OECD, our workplace environment and many other policies supporting staff in their daily life.Please note that the appointment may be made at one grade lower in the specified job family, based on the qualifications and professional experience of the selected applicant.This vacancy may be used to create a pool of candidates for comparable positions, both for open-ended and fixed-term functions.

Selection Process

For retained candidates, written tests/video-recorded interviews are foreseen in October 2025 and panel interviews are planned for November 2025.

The OECD is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes the applications of all qualified candidates who are nationals of OECD member countries, irrespective of their racial or ethnic origin, opinions or beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, health or disabilities.

The OECD promotes an optimal use of resources in order to improve its efficiency and effectiveness. Staff members are encouraged to actively contribute to this goal.
full_text:
Data Engineers, Paris Company Description

The OECD is a global economic forum working with 36 member countries and more than 100 emerging and developing economies to make better policies for better lives. Our mission is to promote policies that will improve the economic and social well-being of people around the world. The Organisation provides a unique forum in which governments work together to share experiences on what drives economic, social and environmental change, seeking solutions to common problems.

The International Energy Agency (IEA) is an intergovernmental organisation committed to advancing security of energy supply, economic growth and environmental sustainability through energy policy co-operation. The IEA operates as an autonomous body within the framework of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development. Both the OECD and the IEA seek opportunities to work with an increasing number of non-members of growing importance to the world economy.

IEA‚Äôs Information Systems Unit (ISU) provides the IT infrastructure, systems, and applications that support the IEA‚Äôs core substantive work, including the management of energy statistics databases and related applications. The IEA is seeking to crate a talent pool for Data Engineer positions potentially upcoming in the next 12 months. Data Engineers will work on the ongoing modernization of the IEA‚Äôs data architecture. This role will allow for candidates to work on a high-performance, scalable, and cost-effective centralized data platform‚Äîgrounded in data warehouse principles and modern engineering practices‚Äîto deliver reliable, high-quality data to energy analysts and economists for in-depth market research and analysis.

Successful candidates will be given and opportunity to be considered for potential upcoming positions which may start as early as January 2026. Data Engineers will work under the supervision of the Lead Data Solution Architect and the Head of the Information Systems Unit.
Job Description

Main Responsibilities
Work with ISU and other teams to analyse, develop, test and deploy optimised, data and business intelligence solutions to help manage our growing data infrastructure.Collaborate with engineers and data analysts to build and maintain Python-based backend services that support data processing and AI applications.Contribute to the development of internal tools such as chatbots, semantic search engines, or dataset assistants using modern AI frameworks.Assist in the implementation and improvement of data pipelines, APIs, and vector search systems under senior guidance.Participate in projects that integrate language models (LLMs) like GPT or LLaMA into secure applications that respect confidentiality and data sovereignty.Help containerize applications using Docker and support deployment in our hybrid (cloud + on-prem) environment.Support testing, code reviews, and documentation of key software components.Learn about our data warehouse ecosystem and contribute to projects that improve data access, validation, or reporting.Work with senior engineers to identify innovative uses of AI and build small prototypes that can evolve into production tools..

Example Projects You‚Äôll Contribute To
Secure AI Assistant for Reports: Help build tools that allow IEA staff to ask questions and retrieve insights from internal reports, using retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) and LLMs. Data Validation Pipelines: Support the creation of automated checks that align datasets with the narratives of official publications. Open-Source LLM Experiments: Assist in experimenting with self-hosted models like Mistral or LLaMA and deploy them on-prem using tools like vLLM and LangChain. Internal Python Libraries: Contribute to shared Python codebases that make our data processing more consistent and reusable. Maintaining the IEA Data Warehouse: Participate in the upkeep and improvement of our SQL Server‚Äìbased data warehouse, helping to ensure data integrity, optimize queries, and support analytics and reporting pipelines used across the agency.

In addition to leading key projects, you‚Äôll have space to innovate‚Äîpartnering with analysts and engineers to frame and deliver AI-driven solutions with real impact.
Qualifications

Ideal Candidate Profile

Academic Background
Undergraduate degree or higher in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Management Information Systems, Data Management, or a related field.

Professional Background
3+ years of experience in data engineering, infrastructure, or software development.Very good programming skills in Python, with a good grasp of software engineering principles.Skilled in agile delivery, version control, testing, and CI/CD.Interest in learning how to work with tools like Docker, Git, Milvus, Azure, or Hugging Face Transformers.Experience building data-driven applications or APIs, with awareness of usability and long-term maintainability.Familiarity with developing user-facing tools in Dash.Strong grasp of ETL design, data pipelines (e.g., Dagster), and SQL-based data warehousing.Experience with Linux systems, virtualization (e.g., Hyper-V, VMware), and general server management.Strong knowledge of SQL and data modeling is a plus.Strong desire to work in a mission-driven environment and grow your technical skills with real mentorship.Demonstrated self-motivation and ability to work independently as well as to work collaboratively and effectively in small technical/engineering teams

Core Competencies

OECD staff are expected to demonstrate behaviours aligned to six core competencies which will be assessed as part of this hiring processes: Vision and Strategy (Level 1); Enable People (Level 1); Ethics and Integrity (Level 2); Collaboration and Horizontality (Level 2); Achieve Results (Level 2); Innovate and Embrace Change (Level 2).

There are three possible levels for each competency. The level for each competency is determined according to the specific needs of each job role and its associated grade.

To learn more about the definitions for each competency for levels 1-3, please refer to OECD Core Competencies

Languages
Excellent knowledge of written and spoken English; working knowledge of French would be an advantage. Additional Information

Closing Date
This vacancy should be filled by the beginning of 2026, and applications should reach us no later than midnight August 17, 2025 (Paris time).

Contract Duration
This is a generic recruitment to identify a talent pool for potential future upcoming positions.IEA offers a fixed-term contracts initially for 24 months, with the possibility of renewal.

What the OECD offers
Depending on level of experience, monthly salary starts at 5,185.99 EUR, plus allowances based on eligibility, exempt of French income tax.Click here to consult the Staff Regulations applicable to officials of the OECD. Please note that from 1 July 2025, all Official appointments will be made under the OECD‚Äôs new contractual modalities.Click here to learn more about what we offer and why the OECD is a great place to work. Click here to browse our People Management Guidebook and learn more about all aspects relating to people at the OECD, our workplace environment and many other policies supporting staff in their daily life.Please note that the appointment may be made at one grade lower in the specified job family, based on the qualifications and professional experience of the selected applicant.This vacancy may be used to create a pool of candidates for comparable positions, both for open-ended and fixed-term functions.

Selection Process

For retained candidates, written tests/video-recorded interviews are foreseen in October 2025 and panel interviews are planned for November 2025.

The OECD is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes the applications of all qualified candidates who are nationals of OECD member countries, irrespective of their racial or ethnic origin, opinions or beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, health or disabilities.

title: Data Analytics Engineer
description:
Data Analytics Engineer

Day 1 Onsite in Paris, France

Long term contract

Hybrid ‚Äì 3 days onsite and 2 days remote

We are looking for a data analytics engineer (a data engineer who specializes in the data analytics space) with the following expertise:

Core Professional Competencies

1. Communication: Clearly communicates technical work to diverse audiences, verbally and in writing. Participate in peer reviews and team discussions with clarity and purpose.

2. Documentation: Maintains clear, structured documentation of project logic, decisions, and maintenance. Contributes to team standards for reproducibility and transparency.

3. Collaboration: Works effectively with cross-functional partners. Values shared ownership and ensured continuity through knowledge sharing.

4. Initiative: Comfortable in ambiguity; proactively identifies issues and opportunities. Demonstrates curiosity and critical thinking.

5. Attention to Detail: Delivers high-quality, consistent code and documentation that supports long-term maintainability and trust in data systems.

Data Engineering Expertise (5+ years)

1. Experienced in building and maintaining data pipelines (ETL/ELT)

2. Proficient with orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, dbt, Prefect)

3. Comfortable working with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS) and tools like Snowflake

4. Familiar with data lake and warehouse architecture (e.g., S3 + Athena, Delta Lake)

5. Strong Python skills for data manipulation (e.g., pandas, pyarrow, pyspark)

Data Infrastructure & Management (5+ years)

1. Expertise in data modeling (star/snowflake schemas, normalization, dimensional modeling)

2. Skilled in maintaining data quality and integrity (data monitoring, validation, deduplication, anomaly detection)

3. Familiar with version control, CI/CD practices for data workflows (e.g., Git)

Required Skills ‚Äì Experience

¬∑ Data Migration ‚Äì 5-10 Years

¬∑ Database Technologies ‚Äì 5-10 Years

¬∑ Advanced SQL ‚Äì 5-10 Years

¬∑ Data Engineering ‚Äì 5-10 Years

¬∑ Python ‚Äì 5-10 Years

¬∑ Snowflake ‚Äì 5-10 Years

title: Data Engineer - Remote, Full-Time
description:
Data Engineer

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Upway is the leading marketplace for refurbished e-bikes across Europe and the United States. You will be part of a tight-knit, high-performing team ( Our tech & product office is located in Paris, near Auber.

We are looking for our very first Data Engineer , who will lay the foundation of our data stack.

Your work will go beyond creating data pipelines: you must be interested in solving real-world business problems . You will be in charge of understanding business needs, prioritizing them, building solutions and ensuring these solutions are useful and used.

Discover all the data sources available, and understand how to combine them to have the finest levels of understanding of our business. Laying the foundations of our data architecture. At this stage, we believe our stack will be BigQuery, Airbyte and DBT, but you can challenge these choices.

Build our data warehouse in BigQuery and connectors from

Create post-processing scripts to make external data easily accessible and usable

Help build dashboards to link our operations data to customer tickets and reviews

Understanding in depth where we collect data and how

Provide suggestions to the tech team on which data to collect or what context to add

Synchronize ecommerce data to our data warehouse

You understand what data is available and how they can be used in harmony to provide the finest insights

Solid experience with modern data technologies and best practices. Experience: 3-5+ years in data engineering, with a proven ability to design and build data pipelines, and to extract valuable business insights from it

You value having equity as part of your compensation and want to be rewarded for the value you create.

‚Ä¢ Team, Remote and Compensation Policy

For certain roles, such as operations, on-site work is essential and may require a full-time presence. Upway is committed to fair pay, embracing diverse backgrounds, and cultivating a culture of excellence. We want to attract and reward talent competitively, and therefore offer a package that includes a competitive base salary and a generous stock option grant.

title: Big Data & Cloud Data Engineer
description:
Position Overview

We are seeking a Big Data & Cloud Data Engineer to design, implement, and manage large-scale data processing systems using big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka) and cloud-based data ecosystems (Azure, GCP, AWS), enabling advanced analytics and real-time data processing capabilities across our enterprise.

Key Responsibilities

Big Data Platform Development
‚Ä¢ Design and implement Hadoop ecosystems including HDFS, YARN, and distributed computing frameworks
‚Ä¢ Develop real-time and batch processing applications using Apache Spark (Scala, Python, Java)
‚Ä¢ Configure Apache Kafka for event streaming, data ingestion, and real-time data pipelines
‚Ä¢ Implement data processing workflows using Apache Airflow, Oozie, and workflow orchestration tools
‚Ä¢ Build NoSQL database solutions using HBase, Cassandra, and MongoDB for high-volume data storage

Cloud Data Architecture
‚Ä¢ Design multi-cloud data architectures using Azure Data Factory, AWS Glue, and Google Cloud Dataflow
‚Ä¢ Implement data lakes and lakehouses using Azure Data Lake, AWS S3, and Google Cloud Storage
‚Ä¢ Configure cloud-native data warehouses including Snowflake, BigQuery, and Azure Synapse Analytics
‚Ä¢ Build serverless data processing solutions using AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, and Google Cloud Functions
‚Ä¢ Implement containerized data applications using Docker, Kubernetes, and cloud container services

Data Pipeline Engineering
‚Ä¢ Develop ETL/ELT pipelines for structured and unstructured data processing
‚Ä¢ Create real-time streaming analytics using Kafka Streams, Apache Storm, and cloud streaming services
‚Ä¢ Implement data quality frameworks, monitoring, and alerting for production data pipelines
‚Ä¢ Build automated data ingestion from various sources including APIs, databases, and file systems
‚Ä¢ Design data partitioning, compression, and optimization strategies for performance

Platform Administration & Optimization
‚Ä¢ Manage cluster provisioning, scaling, and resource optimization across big data platforms
‚Ä¢ Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and implement capacity planning strategies
‚Ä¢ Configure security frameworks including Kerberos, Ranger, and cloud IAM services
‚Ä¢ Implement backup, disaster recovery, and high availability solutions
‚Ä¢ Optimize query performance and implement data governance policies

Required Qualifications

Technical Skills
‚Ä¢ 5+ years experience with big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Hive, HBase)
‚Ä¢ Strong programming skills in Python, Scala, Java, and SQL for data processing
‚Ä¢ Expert knowledge of at least one major cloud platform (Azure, AWS, GCP) and data services
‚Ä¢ Experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and infrastructure as code (Terraform, CloudFormation)
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in stream processing frameworks and real-time analytics architectures
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of data modeling, schema design, and database optimization techniques

Data Engineering Skills
‚Ä¢ Experience with data pipeline orchestration and workflow management tools
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of distributed systems, parallel processing, and scalability patterns
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of data formats (Parquet, Avro, ORC) and serialization frameworks
‚Ä¢ Experience with version control, CI/CD pipelines, and DevOps practices for data platforms

Preferred Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or related field
‚Ä¢ Cloud certifications (Azure Data Engineer, AWS Data Analytics, Google Cloud Data Engineer)
‚Ä¢ Experience with machine learning platforms and MLOps frameworks
‚Ä¢ Background in data governance, data cataloging, and metadata management
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of emerging technologies (Delta Lake, Apache Iceberg, dbt)

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of distributed systems, parallel processing, and scalability patterns

Preferred Qualifications

‚Ä¢ Cloud certifications (Azure Data Engineer, AWS Data Analytics, Google Cloud Data Engineer)
‚Ä¢ Experience with machine learning platforms and MLOps frameworks
‚Ä¢ Background in data governance, data cataloging, and metadata management
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of emerging technologies (Delta Lake, Apache Iceberg, dbt)

title: Senior AWS Data Engineer
description:
Tasks
‚Ä¢ Implement new use cases and data pipelines on AWS
‚Ä¢ Map data and data flows across cloud platforms
‚Ä¢ Develop and industrialize data pipelines and processing workflows
‚Ä¢ Design and build dashboards and reporting tools
‚Ä¢ Perform unit and integration testing of data flows
‚Ä¢ Participate in Data Reply events (Reply Xchange, hackathons, AWS summits, Lab Camps...)
‚Ä¢ Support team leaders in building packaged offers

Benefits
‚Ä¢ Work on diverse cloud environments for well-known national and international clients
‚Ä¢ Certification program aligned with your goals, fully funded with additional bonuses
‚Ä¢ Structured career path with opportunities in both technical and managerial roles
‚Ä¢ Friendly and collaborative work environment with regular afterworks
‚Ä¢ Opportunities to join Hackathons, Code Challenges, and internal learning events

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ At least 3 years of experience as a Data Engineer, with at least one solution deployed on AWS
‚Ä¢ Master‚Äôs Degree in Data, Data Analystics or Computer Science or other relevant field of studies
‚Ä¢ Fluent in both English and French
‚Ä¢ Experience with ETL tools (e.g., Glue, Rivery, DBT, Airbyte)
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with real-time data technologies (Kafka, Kinesis, Confluent, Databricks) is a plus
‚Ä¢ Willingness to lead on new client engagements or support internal junior training

About Data Reply

Data Reply is the Reply Group company offering a broad range of analytics and data processing services. We operate across different industries and business functions, working directly with executive level professionals, enabling them to achieve meaningful outcomes through effective use of data.

We find that one of the biggest problems experienced by our clients today is being overwhelmed with the amount of data they face and not knowing how to leverage it to their advantage.

The vast landscape of available technology stacks and models means that choosing the right ones can be a daunting task.

Most companies know that their data is valuable, and that they should be making the most out of it to stay competitive, but often don‚Äôt know where to begin or what to prioritise.

At Data Reply, we pride ourselves on helping clients make the right decisions to build their data strategy.

With our consultants‚Äô expertise, we map the right technologies to meet our clients‚Äô business needs.

We deal in bespoke solutions, and offer in-house training to ensure that our clients realise the full value of their big data solution. www.data.reply.com

title: Lead Analytics Engineer (All Genders)
description:
Dailymotion is seeking for a dynamic and motivated DevOps Engineer with a strong interest in site reliability and software production. As part of the Platform team, with a strong experience in distributed software architectures and release management, you will contribute to building our internal Platform-as-a-Service running on Kubernetes. You will also be responsible of the maintenance and the evolution of our CD platform based on FluxCD.

The ideal candidate dreams of efficient orchestration and scalable and resilient architecture.

Using AGILE methodologies in collaboration with other teams you will help support Dailymotion's business growth by defining appropriate systems and architectures that can handle our development needs and processing volumes.

The successful candidate will have various responsibilities and roles:
‚Ä¢ Ensure that the platform is reliable and performant through testing, automation and monitoring
‚Ä¢ Participate in the on-call program to provide application support, handle incident management, and troubleshoot production issues
‚Ä¢ Ensure optimal use of our Kubernetes clusters in AWS environment, from performance perspective and cost effectiveness perspective ( FinOps)
‚Ä¢ Ensure a high level of platform security.
‚Ä¢ Maintain and improve our CD platform and delivery workflows
‚Ä¢ Share best practices with your peers
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with developers to understand their specifics requirements, while continuously improving the architecture and deepening your understanding of the global system. The right component for the right need.
‚Ä¢ Provide guidance on MLOPS and Data architectures (Cloud GCP, Airflow, GPUs)
‚Ä¢ Maintain detailed documentation of engineering processes, infrastructures, and troubleshooting procedures.
‚Ä¢ Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data engineering and devops to drive innovation and continuous improvement.

Description du profil :
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience in DevOps.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm).
‚Ä¢ Proficiency with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform).
‚Ä¢ Strong Expertise with Cloud Platforms (AWS,GCP)
‚Ä¢ Strong Expertise in CD pipelines (Flux)
‚Ä¢ Strong Expertise in monitoring and observability capabilities, including FinOps best practices (Prometheus, Grafana,Datadog, Looker)
‚Ä¢ Experience with Data lifecycle Management (Storage policies, costs optimization , security, encryption).
‚Ä¢ Experience in Data pipelines for ML models (Airflow,DataFlow,Kestra)
‚Ä¢ Experience in ML infrastructure optimization (GPUs,TPUs, Inferentia).
‚Ä¢ Experience in CI pipelines (Tekton, Jenkins,Jx3)
‚Ä¢ Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in Bash scripting; knowledge of Go or Rust is a plus.

Soft Skills
‚Ä¢ Strong collaboration and communication skills to work effectively with Dev Engineers and cross-functional teams.
‚Ä¢ Ability to drive innovation and advocate for best DevOps practices within the company.
‚Ä¢ Cultural Alignment: We seek a creative, motivated individual who values growth and is eager to contribute to our team and product
‚Ä¢ Excellent English communication skills, capable of working effectively in an international team.

Technical Stacks and environments
‚Ä¢ AWS, GCP and on-premise datacenters (multi regions)
‚Ä¢ Kubernetes self hosted, EKS, GKE
‚Ä¢ Aerospike, MongoDB, Redis, Druid, Mysql, PgSql
‚Ä¢ Ingress-nginx
‚Ä¢ Cert-manager,Kyverno,EntraID
‚Ä¢ Karpenter
‚Ä¢ Datadog, Prometheus ,Grafana,Costory
‚Ä¢ Terraform, Atlantis,Ansible,salt-stack
‚Ä¢ FluxCD
‚Ä¢ Tekton, , JenkinsX
‚Ä¢ Airflow, Dataflow, Flink
‚Ä¢ Python. Go, Java
‚Ä¢ Harbor

title: Staff Analytics Engineer
description:
**Staff Analytics Engineer (Global Analytics)**

Our Global Analytics team within the platform tribe, plays a vital role in empowering all other tribes to make data-driven decisions globally. The team is responsible for creating efficient and effective data models for finance and providing an analytics framework and process to all SumUppers to maximise the value of data across the organisation.

The Staff Analytics Engineer role will be an individual contributor role within the team working across finance and global projects. This role will be instrumental in setting up the standards and rolling out frameworks for building data models and other analytics processes by keeping the data quality as utmost priority.

Some of the tools and technologies used in the team:

- Airflow, dbt for data modelling and orchestration
- Snowflake for data warehousing
- Tableau Online for visualisation
- AWS Cloud for all analytics back end infrastructure
- Python
‚Ä¢ *What you'll do**:

- Lead the design and implementation of finance and global data products that require high level of control and quality
- Collaborate on the strategy and vision for providing a best-in-class self-service analytics platform across SumUp using data mesh principles
- Foster knowledge sharing and advocate for the standardisation of analytics best practices by actively engaging with the data chapter.
- Provide coaching and mentoring to analytics engineers, contributing to the continuous improvement of data practices throughout the organisation.
- Leverage data to drive informed business decisions and outcomes through analysis, data visualisation and data storytelling
‚Ä¢ *You'll be great for this role if**:

- You have relevant experience in the analytics, data warehousing, data engineering domains with the ability to drive global complex data projects
- You have a solid experience working with DBT
- You are an expert with programming language Python and SQL
- You have experience in designing, building and managing complex data models at scale (normalisation techniques, Kimbal design patterns etc.,)
- You can analyse the stakeholder needs, business requirements and translate them into data products
- You have experience with building advanced dashboards and presenting the finding to non technical and business users
- You have experience working with cloud data warehouse ideally, Snowflake and AWS platforms
- You are able to coach, inspire and motivate analytics team members
‚Ä¢ *Nice to have**:

- Experience with data mesh architecture
- Any experience working with a finance domain
- Experience with migration of legacy frameworks to dbt frameworks
‚Ä¢ *Why you should join SumUp**:
Our working setup offers the flexibility of both hybrid and on-site options in the vibrant cities of Berlin, Paris, and London. We want to ensure you have the best experience possible, so please let us know your preferred location, and we'll be delighted to accommodate your needs.

A dedicated annual L&D budget for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education

Enrolment onto our VSOP program - you will own a stake in SumUp's future success.

‚Äç The opportunity to work on large scale fintech products used by millions of businesses around the world

A corporate pension scheme where we match up to 20% of your contributions
‚Ä¢ *About us**:
SumUp is a leading financial technology company, founded in 2012 with the goal of empowering small businesses around the globe. We're the financial partner of choice for more than 4 million merchants in over 35 markets. We collectively build, plan and fine-tune the technology that drives SumUp and empowers small businesses around the world.

We believe in the everyday hero. Those who have the courage to follow their passion and who have the strength and determination to realise their dreams. Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their business. With a founders mentality and a 'team-first attitude' our diverse teams across Europe, South America, and the United States work together to ensure that small business owners can be successful doing what they love.
- SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by Company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind._
‚Ä¢ *Job Application Tip

description:

title: Mid Analytics Engineer (All genders)
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Dailymotion is more than a video app, it's a visual conversation in motion, based on a unique algorithm designed to broaden users' horizons. Dailymotion brings nuance to the debates that animate young people and puts listening, discovery, and kindness back at the heart of interactions to help build a better and safer Internet.

Dailymotion is also "Dailymotion Pro", a video hosting and broadcasting solution for professionals in all sectors; and "Dailymotion Advertising", a powerful, proprietary video advertising platform, offering a high-quality, secure environment for brands.

Our team is made up of 400 people in France, New York, and Singapore, all united by the same ambition: to visibly shake up the global video platform ecosystem.

Dailymotion is seeking an Analytics Engineer to join the Data Engineering Teams. Our craft is responsible for most of the Data products at Dailymotion; your work will have an impact throughout Dailymotion‚Äôs business and help make data-driven decisions on products and strategy.

You'll join the Data Engineering craft at Dailymotion, to create and maintain data products. The Analytics Engineering team focuses on providing reliable data for analysis company-wide. This includes building and managing our multi-petabyte data warehouse, highly scalable client-facing analytics, data ingestion & distribution, and data synchronization systems. As an Analytics Engineer, you'll blend software engineering and data skills to maintain code and model data effectively. If you're eager to solve challenging business problems, this role offers a broad impact across all of Dailymotion's businesses.

Description du poste

Our stack runs almost exclusively on Google Cloud Platform. You will work in an environment made up of Data Lakes (BigQuery, etc.), orchestration and scheduling platforms (Airflow), container-oriented deployment, and management platforms (Docker, K8S, JenkinsX), SQL, Data Quality Tools (DBT, Sifflet). You will also participate in data modeling activities and design of data flows until their implementation and support in production.
‚Ä¢ Expose the data through various means such as datamarts, and flat files for both internal and external users.
‚Ä¢ Build complex and efficient SQL queries to transform data within our data lake into reliable business entities and reporting aggregates. Identify and manage dependencies for these transformations, scheduling them using tools like Airflow.
‚Ä¢ Investigate discrepancies and quality issues in the data, as well as addressing performance issues.
‚Ä¢ Design optimized and cost-efficient data models in BQ while addressing business use cases.
‚Ä¢ Ensure data cleanliness, consistency, and availability by performing data quality checks and implementing monitoring.
‚Ä¢ Catalog and document various aspects of the data, including business entities, datamarts, dimensions, metrics, and business rules.
‚Ä¢ Serve as a subject matter expert on business entities and datamarts, providing training to users on SQL and analytics best practices (collaboration with Business Insight).
‚Ä¢ Innovate by proposing new tools, processes, documentation, and exploring emerging technologies during designated cool-down periods.

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in Data Analytics.
‚Ä¢ Fluent in both English (pro level) and French.
‚Ä¢ Good proficiency with SQL.
‚Ä¢ Strong team player, actively contributing to continuous improvement and fostering effective collaboration.
‚Ä¢ Proactive approach to continuous technical exploration, with a keen interest in implementing new technologies and innovative solutions, including prototyping.
‚Ä¢ Ability to draft technical specifications and good understanding of data modeling techniques (star, snowflake, medallion etc).
‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience in building and managing analytics pipelines.
‚Ä¢ Capable of making informed decisions based on business opportunities.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in at least one of the following programming languages: Python, Golang (preferred) or Java
‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with cloud-based data warehouses, particularly BigQuery/Snowflake.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in monitoring data quality of datasets and investigating discrepancies
‚Ä¢ Good level knowledge on how to analyze, design, or improve the efficiency, scalability, and stability of data collection, storage, and retrieval processes.

If you meet these qualifications and are passionate about leveraging data to drive insights and innovation, we encourage you to apply.

Informations suppl√©mentaires

What we offer you:
‚Ä¢ Additional opportunities as we grow and learn together.
‚Ä¢ Join our open, collaborative culture.
‚Ä¢ Exciting, dynamic projects to work on.
‚Ä¢ Flexibility.

For the France offices
‚Ä¢ Hybrid Work Framework (4 types of remote work : Full office /Flex office (1/2 days remote) / Flex remote (1/2 days at the office) / Full remote + ability to work 3 month abroad)
‚Ä¢ Saving Plan Vivendi
‚Ä¢ Paternity leave or Coparental leave extended

Ô∏è Living Employee Culture (Events / Trainings / Partys / All hands / Dailymotion tradition‚Ä¶)
‚Ä¢ Career development support (training / internal mobility / compensation cycle / 360 quarter feedback review ‚Ä¶)
‚Ä¢ High-end Health Insurance and Personal Services Vouchers (CESU)
‚Ä¢ * Ô∏è Paid Time off ‚Äì RTT and Saving time plan (CET)
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Meal Vouchers ‚Äì Public Transport and Bike refund
‚Ä¢ European Economic and Social Committee (sport membership/cinemas vouchers/gift vouchers/discount)

title: Business Intelligence Analyst M/F/X
description:
1 week ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.

At JobTeaser, we believe each and every student has the ability to achieve greatness. That‚Äôs why we have set ourselves the mission of preparing the new generation to reach their full potential, find their path, embrace the future with optimism and make their mark in the world.

We are the European leader in the recruitment and guidance of young talent. To this end, we offer an internship and job search platform, integrated directly into more than 800 schools and universities, which enables 5 million students and recent graduates to find their path, thanks to JobTeaser.

We are a team of 200 talented and passionate people, across 6 countries in Europe.

Now, a question for you: are you ready to have an impact on the next generation?

Job Description

As Business Intelligence analyst, you will be joining JobTeaser‚Äôs Analytics team, and report to Maxime, our Lead Data Analyst.

The Analytics team was merged recently with the Strategy team in order to foster the synergy between the 2 teams. Indeed, the Product Marketing Managers are, in particular, data-savvy and internal clients of dashboarding.

Our responsibilities, within the Analytics teams, cover:
‚Ä¢ Build best-in-class reporting (internal reports, dashboards, export, embedded analytics in JobTeaser product) that will help every team activate their data, make informed decisions, and fuel client and user satisfaction.
‚Ä¢ Provide analytics expertise to support internal decision making and provide insights to our university partners and company clients: this includes designing the right metrics to follow our activity, assess the performance of our product features, monitor the performance of our acquisition campaigns, ‚Ä¶ and so much more !
‚Ä¢ Democratize access to data inside the company, so everyone (Product Managers, Marketing teams, Sales, Operations, C-Level, etc.) can easily and autonomously access the data they need, without depending too much on the Analytics team.

As Business Intelligence analyst, you will have a key role in the decision making process of both strategic and operational teams at JobTeaser. Your main focus will be to unlock the monitoring of Customer‚Äôs activities on the platform.

In the framework of your projects, you will work closely with 4 types of stakeholders:
‚Ä¢ our Product Marketing Managers who need data for performing their strategic analysis to implement the right Product strategy at JobTeaser
‚Ä¢ our Product Managers to build reporting embedded in our platform (directly visible to our clients)
‚Ä¢ our Sales representatives who develop the partnership with our customers by advising them on how to use our Product in the best way possible and Business Developers who sell our Product to prospects and show the performance of our Product
‚Ä¢ our ExCom members who need to monitor the high level KPIs related to our companies (for internal purpose and for our investors)

In this context, your objectives will be to:
‚Ä¢ Define the structuring KPIs to monitor our business performance: You will be in charge of capturing the needs of reporting from your main stakeholders and to make proposals of relevant KPI definitions that reach the consensus of your stakeholders. Also, you will be involved in the prioritization of the needs in order to focus on what matters the most.
‚Ä¢ Build dashboards in both our internal reporting platform and our embedded analytics product: You will be in charge of making proposals of visualization for each needs, structuring your dashboards so that they are easy to use, making pleasant and good looking templates to foster the usage by all our stakeholders.
‚Ä¢ Build the data sources needed for your dashboards and for other Data users: With the help of the Lead Data Analyst, you will be in charge of building the data sources in SQL you need for the dashboards, which can be re-used by other BI/Data analysts.
‚Ä¢ Monitor the data quality of your data sources and maintain the dashboards: You will be in charge of monitoring the quality of the data displayed in the dashboard and tackling all the discrepancies. Also, you will be in charge of making sure that the dashboard displays up-to-date data.
‚Ä¢ Guide the changement management of our dashboarding practices: You will widespread your expertise by making recommendations on how to improve our existing dashboards, and provide your expertise to others (Data Analyst, PMs, PMMs) in charge of making dashboarding.
‚Ä¢ Train and provide assistance to the users of our dashboard: You will be in charge of structuring the documentation and the training to be provided to the users. As training is key in the adoption process, your role will be to make sure that the dashboards are used in the end.
‚Ä¢ Train our Power Users on our dashboarding platform: You will be in charge, with the other BI analysts, to train operations teams on how to build dashboards on their own, on simple use cases in order for them to be autonomous.

Examples of projects you will work on:
‚Ä¢ Build a new version of the dashboard embedded in the platform for our school partners that reports the most important KPIs: benchmark of the activity of their schools in the platform vs. other schools, activity of each module (active users), etc. This embedded dashboard will be available on the platform.
‚Ä¢ Build dashboards on various topics:
‚Ä¢ Follow the performance of new products such as a tool for our recruiters to proactively search for the right talent in JobTeaser. We will need to monitor how many recruiters use it and how they use this new feature.
‚Ä¢ Iterate on existing reporting for our external customers that are used in monthly or yearly meetings. These dashboards are fully operational and the idea would be to add new views, depending on the needs.
‚Ä¢ and many others!
‚Ä¢ Structure of the data sources and exports to be provided internally or externally on customer‚Äôs engagement metrics:
‚Ä¢ writing SQL queries of standard tables / datamarts
‚Ä¢ ensuring, by using the tools developed by our data engineers, that the data is refreshed on a daily basis.
‚Ä¢ Contribute to a strategy to provide data tables to external customers: build data tables in DBT that will be then delivered via APIs by the TECH teams.

Also, we aim at developing your skills: developing best-in-class data models in DBT to create efficient data tables, usage of our datalakehouse to confront yourself with ‚ÄúBig Data‚Äù cases.

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ You have at least 3 years of experience in Business Intelligence
‚Ä¢ You graduated from a Masters degree (5 years of studies) in Engineering, Business or equivalent studies at the university
‚Ä¢ You have a great business sense
‚Ä¢ You have a great challenge spirit and you know how to organize workshops with people from the operations in order to frame their needs
‚Ä¢ You master SQL and you have a great experience in at least 1 BI tool (Tableau would be a plus). A first experience with DBT (to build data tables) would also be a plus but not a blocker.
‚Ä¢ You are autonomous in tracking operations problems by using data
‚Ä¢ You know how to use, report data and you know how to explain to a tech and non tech audience the power of leveraging data
‚Ä¢ You speak, write in professional English (an international experience would be a plus)

At JobTeaser, get ready to‚Ä¶
‚Ä¢ Join a mission-driven company with a concrete impact on the new generation.
‚Ä¢ Share our three core virtues with our people all over Europe: #Committed, #OneTeam, #DrivEn.
‚Ä¢ Participate to our dynamic internal life, where all our employees can contribute (all-hands, local parties, team-drinks, day out with your team, etc).
‚Ä¢ Grow and develop your career with JobTeaser thanks to our strong training policy (more than 95% of our employees have been trained last year!).
‚Ä¢ Be part to an inclusive environment when everyone can find their place
‚Ä¢ Enjoy our super flexible remote environment with 1 month per year wherever you want in Europe, with a home office financial support for equipment. For some positions, it is possible to be fully remote.
‚Ä¢ Enjoy the basics: RTT, health insurance, lunch voucher card, holiday bonus, public transportation reimbursed (50%).

Your hiring process and the next steps

In order to identify the perfect fit for us (and also for you!), we offer a comprehensive hiring process with the possibility to get to know all your future key team members, and between each step of your process, you will receive constructive feedback from our Talent team.
‚Ä¢ A 30-min screening call to get to know you better with Emilie, our Lead Recruiter
‚Ä¢ A Technical interview with Maxime, our Lead Data Analyst (and your future manager), and a member of our PMM Team to test your hard skills
‚Ä¢ An interview with Maxime and Jean-C√¥me, our Head of Strategy, PMM & Analytics, to discuss about your experiences and motivations
‚Ä¢ A final round with Juliette, our Managing Director, to confirm the mutual match
‚Ä¢ Welcome at JobTeaser

We are committed to creating a working environment where everyone feels comfortable. We promote diversity within our teams and every application we receive is screened through a unique, pre-established, competency-based process.
Seniority level
‚Ä¢ Seniority level Associate
Employment type
‚Ä¢ Employment type Full-time
Job function
‚Ä¢ Job function Analyst and Information Technology
‚Ä¢ Industries Staffing and Recruiting

Referrals increase your chances of interviewing at JobTeaser by 2x
